intro_text: While gathering herbs, r_c spots a bush of red berries.
decline_text: r_c decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: r_c identifies them as raspberries, and carefully chews off a branch laden with them to bring back to camp - the herb stocks can use this odd fruit, especially it's leaves.
r_c knows deathberries when they see them, and slips back to camp to report it to the leader - the warriors will need to be told to avoid this bush.

It takes little intelligence to recognise deathberries, but a great deal to collect them anyway. If s_c can dry them out, these berries will be sufficient for c_n for years to come. By using their weight to snap off a bush branch, and then carefully carrying it back to camp, s_c manages to bring them safely home.
fail_text: While r_c thinks they're probably cranberries, they aren't confident enough with the identification to risk being wrong and plucking deathberries instead.

While plucking them from the bush, r_c feels one of the berries split in their mouth, and a horrible taste coats their tongue. These aren't raspberries. They rush to force themselves to throw up, and it works, expelling the deathberries from their system, but they're weak and shaky for the rest of the day.

intro_text: While gathering herbs, app1 stumbles upon a bush of red berries.
decline_text: app1 decides not to touch the berries.
success_text: app1 identifies them as raspberries, and carefully chews off a branch laden with them to bring back to camp. They can't quite remember what raspberries treat, but it's something to do with kitting.
These. . . could be deathberries. Might be raspberries. But maybe deathberries. It's not worth the risk, they can ask their mentor for more training about it later.
fail_text: Confidently gathering them and prancing back to camp, app1 is then informed that they've gathered raspberries, not cranberries, and this isn't going to help the Clan's elders with their problems.

app1 plucks the berries, several splitting in their mouth, and tries not to gag at the horrible taste - after all, all the herbs they're trying to learn taste horrible. As they start back to camp, they wobble a little. And then the world goes dark.

app1 carefully plucks the horrible tasting berries, and as soon as the taste hits their tongue, they realize they've made a terrible mistake. Gagging and throwing up and staggering, they crawl back to camp, weakly hoping their mentor will help them.
history_text: r_c died before completing their medicine cat training, from accidentally eating deathberries.

By using their weight to snap off a bush branch, and then carefully carrying it gingerly back to camp, s_c manages to bring them safely home.
fail_text: While r_c thinks they're probably cranberries, they aren't confident enough with the identification to risk being wrong and plucking deathberries instead.

intro_text: The patrol finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and the cats have a successful discussion, talking about what came up at the last half-moon meetings and whether it'll affect c_n.
The sunlight energizes the cats for their herb-gathering.
s_c makes sure everyone gets a good basking spot as the cats pause for a little break before resuming their herb gathering.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: r_c finds a nice spot to sun themselves.
decline_text: They decide to stay focused instead.
success_text: The sunlight feels great and r_c has a successful patrol.
The sunlight energizes r_c for the rest of their herb-gathering.
fail_text: The patrol doesn't get much done because of that.

intro_text: As the medicine cat's patrol pads out into c_n territory, r_c tells p_l about the dream they had last night, and what the StarClan vision could mean for c_n.
decline_text: The cats don't talk about the vision, mouths too full of herbs.
success_text: They have an in-depth conversation about r_c's vision as they walk. By the time they head back to camp, they have a good idea of what they should do with the information.

p_l takes r_c aside, giving them the full benefits of p_l's experience as they discuss r_c's vision. As a medicine cat, they don't take the responsibility lightly, and both of them work together to divine the vision's meaning.

p_l chooses to pad pelt to pelt with r_c, the spiritual medicine cat gently guiding the conversation. r_c feels deeply privileged and far more at peace after confiding in them, knowing that c_n is in safe paws.
fail_text: p_l shakes their head sadly. They can't make sense of the vision.
r_c notices p_l looking at them enviously, and withdraws from the group, dismissing the dream as unimportant.

intro_text: As the medicine cat's patrol pads out into c_n territory, r_c tells p_l about the dream they had last night, and what the StarClan vision could mean for c_n.
decline_text: The cats don't talk about the vision, mouths too full of herbs.
success_text: They have an in depth conversation about r_c's vision as they walk. By the time they head back to camp, they have a good idea of what they should do with the information.

p_l takes r_c aside, giving them the full benefits of p_l's seniority and experience as they discuss r_c's vision. As a medicine cat, they don't take the responsibility lightly, and both of them work together to divine the vision's meaning.

s_c listens intently and tells r_c not to be weirded out, but they had seen the dream, too. r_c is alarmed but s_c soothes them and explains that StarClan sometimes shows them others' dreams, but this one luckily was just a mild warning.
fail_text: p_l shakes their head sadly. They can't make sense of the vision.
r_c notices p_l looking at them enviously, and withdraws from the group, dismissing the dream as unimportant.

intro_text: As they head out to gather cobwebs, r_c thinks about the dream they had last night. . . was it sent by StarClan?
decline_text: They push it from their mind.
success_text: It definitely distracts them from the hunt for cobwebs, but r_c uses the time by themselves to put their thoughts in order. The sign from their ancestors will need acting upon, and they return to camp to assemble the leader and deputy.

Somehow cobweb-gathering brings r_c to almost a meditative state, and not only are they fairly confident of their next steps having been given this vision, but they also bring back a good haul to the medicine den stocks.

s_c often feels like StarClan walks with them, and this is just another instance on the path. They use the solo patrol to collect their thoughts, and by the time they pad home with a good bundle of cobwebs, they're ready for the next step their vision hinted at.
fail_text: r_c can't make sense of the vision.

intro_text: As r_c pads through c_n territory, they feel a presence join them.
decline_text: Their companion stays with them as silent support while they work.
success_text: With a respectful nod, r_c pauses, tucks their paws together neatly, and sits to converse with the StarClan cat.
The scent of a familiar pelt reaches r_c's nose - they know this cat! With a friendly purr, they turn to greet their friend from beyond the grave.
With the familiarity brought by their connection to StarClan, r_c turns to the ghost haunting their path, meeting their star-walking ancestor with a purr and quiet confidence.
fail_text: The connection wavers, and as quickly as the feeling of company appears, it vanishes.
r_c turns to the ghost with a smile, but the StarClan cat meets their eyes with fire in their gaze. StarClan is unhappy with c_n, and things must change.
antagonize_text: r_c feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. The ghost vanishes like a puff of fog in the morning sun, hopefully not to return.
antagonize_fail_text: r_c feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. But when they turn around, there's only a rather upset looking clanmate, there to fetch them to camp to help with an emergency.

intro_text: As p_l pads through c_n territory with their entourage, they feel a presence join them.
decline_text: Their companion stays with them as silent support while they continue on.
success_text: p_l softly alerts the rest of the patrol of their visitor. With respectful nods, the patrol pauses, tucks their paws together neatly, and sit to converse with the StarClan cat.
The scent of a familiar pelt reaches r_c's nose - they know this cat! With a friendly purr, they turn to greet their friend from beyond the grave. The rest of the patrol gives them some space.
With the familiarity brought by their connection to StarClan, s_c turns to the ghost haunting their path, meeting their star-walking ancestor with a purr and quiet confidence.
fail_text: The connection wavers, and as quickly as the feeling of company appears, it vanishes.
r_c turns to the ghost with a smile, but the StarClan cat meets their eyes with fire in their gaze. StarClan is unhappy with c_n, and things must change.
antagonize_text: r_c feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. The ghost vanishes like a puff of fog in the morning sun, hopefully not to return.
antagonize_fail_text: r_c feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. But when they turn around, there's only a rather upset looking clanmate, there to fetch them to camp to help with an emergency.

intro_text: As app1 pads through c_n territory, they feel a presence join them.
decline_text: Their companion stays with them as silent support while they work. It's a little unnerving, but app1 thinks they mean well?
success_text: This is utterly unnerving, but with a respectful and shaky nod, app1 pauses, tucks their paws together neatly, and sits to converse with the StarClan cat.
The scent of a familiar pelt reaches app1's nose - they know this cat! They wheel around and bury their face in sparkling fur, purring frantically.
fail_text: The connection wavers, and as quickly as the feeling of company appears, it vanishes. app1 pads uncertainly back to camp, wondering if it was even real in the first place.

app1 turns to the ghost with a smile, but the StarClan cat meets their eyes with fire in their gaze. StarClan is unhappy with c_n, and things must change. app1 cowers in front of them, wishing they were anywhere else.
antagonize_text: app1 feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. The ghost vanishes like a puff of fog in the morning sun, hopefully not to return.
antagonize_fail_text: app1 feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. But when they turn around, there's only a rather upset looking clanmate, there to fetch them to camp to help with an emergency.

intro_text: As app1 pads through c_n territory, they feel a presence join them.
decline_text: Their companion stays with them as silent support while they work.
success_text: With respectful nods, the patrol pauses. app1 takes their lead from p_l and tucks their paws together neatly, sitting to converse with the StarClan cat.
The scent of a familiar pelt reaches app1's nose - they know this cat! They wheel around and bury their face in sparkling fur, purring frantically.

With the familiarity brought by their connection to StarClan, s_c turns to the ghost haunting their path, meeting their Star-walking ancestor with a purr and quiet confidence. app1 watches with eyes as round and dark as the new moon.
fail_text: The connection wavers, and as quickly as the feeling of company appears, it vanishes.
app1 turns to the ghost with a smile, but the StarClan cat meets their eyes with fire in their gaze. StarClan is unhappy with c_n, and things must change.
antagonize_text: app1 feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. The ghost vanishes like a puff of fog in the morning sun, hopefully not to return.
antagonize_fail_text: app1 feels hounded, never given a moment's peace, and they hiss at the StarClan cat. But when they turn around, there's only a rather upset looking clanmate, there to fetch them to camp to help with an emergency.

intro_text: p_l heads out into the territory to stock up on cobwebs, something the Clan never seems to have enough of.
decline_text: They have second thoughts leaving their patients behind and decide to go another day.
success_text: p_l finds lots of cobwebs and gathers them with sticks. No cat will have the chance to bleed out now!
p_l goes to their favorite cobweb gathering places. Several cats in the camp startle when they pass by them as they are unable to see p_l underneath the many cobwebs they have gathered.
fail_text: Tired from caring for their patients around the clock, the only cobwebs p_l manages to gather are from the cobweb they ran into by accident.

intro_text: p_l heads out into the territory with app1 to stock up on cobwebs and teach the apprentice how to gather one of the Clan's most vital medical tools.
decline_text: They have second thoughts leaving their patients behind, especially with their apprentice also out, and decide to go another day.
success_text: p_l finds lots of cobwebs and gathers them with sticks. The apprentice works hard with their mentor to gather as many as possible, their eyes glittering with joy and pride.
p_l  goes to their favorite cobweb gathering places. Several cats in the camp startle when they pass by them as they are unable to see p_l and app1 underneath the many cobwebs they have gathered.
fail_text: app1 doesn't seem to be able to focus today, and p_l isn't much better off, tired from teaching their apprentice and caring for their patients. After app1 accidentally ruins a cobweb while playing with it, p_l decides to call the whole thing off and try again another day.

intro_text: Sensing the cold nip of leaf-bare on the wind, p_l requests the help of any warriors they can find to stock up on some essential herbs before the frost takes them.
decline_text: It turns out that the leader has another urgent task for the Clan's warriors; the herbs will have to wait.
success_text: p_l leads their escort around to all the best herb gathering spots. Thankfully, the frost has yet to come, and each cat is able to gather several mouthfuls of important herbs. The warriors don't even complain too much about the bitter taste.

p_l makes it a priority to gather all the catmint they can find before leaf-bare arrives. With the assistance of the warriors, they're able to bring a good haul of the important herb back to camp, and even discover a new patch while they're out!
fail_text: To p_l's exasperation, the warriors accidentally trample some important herbs, breaking the stems and smashing the leaves. They don't even seem particularly sorry about it, and p_l hisses, assuring them that this will be reported to the leader.

intro_text: Sensing the cold nip of leaf-bare on the wind, p_l requests the help of any warriors they can find to stock up on some essential herbs before the frost takes them.
decline_text: It turns out that the leader has another urgent task for the Clan's warriors; the herbs will have to wait.
success_text: p_l leads their escort to the best herb gathering spots - but the frost has come early, it seems, and some of the plants are already dying. Carefully, the patrol works together to salvage what remains, and each cat returns to camp with a decent mouthful of important herbs.

While the patrol is out gathering herbs, s_c pauses, their intuition niggling at them. Following it, they come upon something special - a previously unknown patch of catmint! This will be invaluable during greencough season.
fail_text: p_l leads their escort to the best herb gathering spots - but the frost has come early, it seems, and most of the plants are already dead. The patrol tries to salvage what they can, but a few leaves and stems are all they have to show for their efforts.

intro_text: p_l noticed that the moss in the medicine den was getting old. They need to go and gather some more.
decline_text: A cat requires their attention just as they go to leave. Moss will have to wait.
success_text: p_l quickly makes their way to the best moss patch they know. They spend a bit of time slicing bits off with their claws, careful not to get any roots or dirt in the pile. Once they're satisfied, they take a moment to wrap their jaws around the heap and make their way back to camp.
fail_text: Mouse-dung! When p_l gets to the best moss-gathering spot, they find that some animal has dug up most of the moss. They'll have to leave the rest to repopulate before gathering from this spot again.

intro_text: p_l noticed that the moss in the medicine den was getting old. They need to go and gather some more.
decline_text: A cat requires their attention just as they go to leave. Moss will have to wait.
success_text: p_l leads the way to the best moss patch they know, with app1 following close behind. The two cats begin cutting off bits of moss and making their respective piles. Once the piles are a mouthful, they pick up the bundles of new bedding and start back towards camp.
fail_text: Mouse-dung! When the two cats arrive at the best moss-gathering spot, they find that some animal has dug up most of the moss. They'll have to leave the rest to repopulate before gathering from this spot again.

intro_text: p_l noticed that the moss in the medicine den was getting old. They need to go and gather some more.
decline_text: A cat requires their attention just as they go to leave. Moss will have to wait.
success_text: p_l leads the way to the best moss patch they know, with r_c following close behind. The two cats begin cutting off bits of moss and making their respective piles. Once the piles are a mouthful, they pick up the bundles of new bedding and start back towards camp.
fail_text: Mouse-dung! When the two cats arrive at the best moss-gathering spot, they find that some animal has dug up most of the moss. They'll have to leave the rest to repopulate before gathering from this spot again.

intro_text: p_l noticed that the moss in the medicine den was getting old. They need to go and gather some more.
decline_text: A cat requires their attention just as they go to leave. Moss will have to wait.
success_text: p_l leads the way to the best moss patch they know, with their entourage following close behind. The cats begin cutting off bits of moss and making their respective piles. Once the piles are a mouthful, they pick up the bundles of new bedding and start back towards camp.
fail_text: Mouse-dung! When the cats arrive at the best moss-gathering spot, they find that some animal has dug up most of the moss. They'll have to leave the rest to repopulate before gathering from this spot again.

intro_text: p_l has to attend to one of their grimmer jobs as a medicine cat. The Clan's burial ground needs to be tended. They're bringing along app1 as their assistant for this trip.
decline_text: Just before the medicine cat can leave, a cat calls for their attention.
success_text: p_l points out to app1 each stone that marks the grave of a passed clanmate, making sure that the apprentice knows where to set their paws so as not to tread on anyone. The two cats solemnly go about their task. They pick the useful plants from around the graves to take back to the medicine den and rip up the rest.
fail_text: There's a sharp yowl of pain and a string of muttered curses following it. p_l turns around to see app1 holding one of their paws off the ground. It seems that the apprentice stepped on a thorn. Ouch! They'll have to go back to camp and fix that up.

intro_text: p_l has to attend to one of their grimmer jobs as a medicine cat. The Clan's burial ground needs to be tended. They're bringing along r_c as their assistant for this trip.
decline_text: Just before the medicine cat can leave, a cat calls for their attention.
success_text: p_l points out to r_c each stone that marks the grave of a passed clanmate, making sure that the other cat knows where to set their paws so as not to tread on anyone. The two cats solemnly go about their task. They pick the useful plants from around the graves to take back to the medicine den and rip up the rest.
fail_text: There's a sharp yowl of pain and a string of muttered curses following it. p_l turns around to see r_c holding one of their paws off the ground. It seems that the other cat stepped on a thorn. Ouch! They'll have to go back to camp and fix that up.
